<<<code>>>: $CODE

Question: How to increment a Map value in Java: Say I'm creating a word frequency list, using a Map (probably a HashMap), where each key is a String with the word that's being counted and the value is an Integer that's incremented each time a token of the word is found. Can you help me with this?
Please using this api: Map.get.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Map.get
<<<code>>>: import java.util.HashMap;import java.util.Map;Map<String, Integer> freq = new HashMap<String, Integer>();Integer count = freq.get(word);if (count == null) {freq.put(word, 1);}else {freq.put(word, count + 1);}
<<<explanation>>>: If you look at the API for Map, get operations usually return null when the map does not contain the requested element. Note that this will make a solution.
Question: Type conversion: :I haveprivate HashMap<Key<?>, Val<?>> myMap;In this map under a specified key<T> is always val<T> (the same T). I want to make a function that uses this information and automatically gives me a value converted to given type. Is it possible? Something like this:public class MyClass{    private HashMap<Key<?>, Val<?>> myMap;    public Val<T> getValue(Key<T> key) {        return (Val<T>) myMap.get(key)     }(Type T is not given in the class.)
Please using this api: Map.get.

Answer:<<<api>>>: Map.get
<<<code>>>: import java.util.HashMap;import java.util.Map;Map<String, Integer> freq = new HashMap<String, Integer>();Integer count = freq.get(word);if (count == null) {freq.put(word, 1);}else {freq.put(word, count + 1);}

Question: Type conversion: :I haveprivate HashMap<Key<?>, Val<?>> myMap;In this map under a specified key<T> is always val<T> (the same T). I want to make a function that uses this information and automatically gives me a value converted to given type. Is it possible? Something like this:public class MyClass{    private HashMap<Key<?>, Val<?>> myMap;    public Val<T> getValue(Key<T> key) {        return (Val<T>) myMap.get(key)     }(Type T is not given in the class.)
Please using this api: Map.get.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Map.get
<<<code>>>: import java.util.HashMap;import java.util.Map;Map<Key<?>, Val<?>> myMap;public Val<T> getValue(Key<T> key) {    return (Val<T>) myMap.get(key);}
<<<explanation>>>: This is a simple type conversion.
Question: How to get the first element of a LinkedList in Java: I have a LinkedList<String> and I want to get the first element. How can I do this?
Please using this api: LinkedList.get.
Answer:<<<api>>>: LinkedList.get
<<<code>>>: import java.util.LinkedList;LinkedList<String> list = new LinkedList<String>();String first = list.get(0);
<<<explanation>>>: The first element of a LinkedList is at index 0.
Question: How to get the last element of a LinkedList in Java: I have a LinkedList<String> and I want to get the last element. How can I do this?
Please using this api: LinkedList.get.
Answer:<<<api>>>: LinkedList.get
<<<code>>>: import java.util.LinkedList;LinkedList<String> list = new LinkedList<String>();String last = list.get(list.size() - 1);
<<<explanation>>>: The last element of a LinkedList is at index size() - 1.
Question: How to get the first element of a Queue in Java: I have a Queue<String> and I want to get the first element. How can I do this?
Please using this api: Queue.peek.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Queue.peek
<<<code>>>: import java.util.Queue;Queue<String> queue = new Queue<String>();String first = queue.peek();
<<<explanation>>>: The first element of a Queue is at the front of the queue.
Question: How to get the last element of a Queue in Java: I have a Queue<String> and I want to get the last element. How can I do this?
Please using this api: Queue.peek.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Queue.peek
<<<code>>>: import java.util.Queue;Queue<String> queue = new Queue<String>();String last = queue.peek();
<<<explanation>>>: The last element of a Queue is at the back of the queue.
Question: How to get the first element of a Stack in Java: I have a Stack<String> and I want to get the first element. How can I do this?
Please using this api: Stack.peek.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Stack.peek
<<<code>>>: import java.util.Stack;Stack<String> stack = new Stack<String>();String first = stack.peek();
<<<explanation>>>: The first element of a Stack is at the top of the stack.
Question: How to get the last element of a Stack in Java: I have a Stack<String> and I want to get the last element. How can I do this?
Please using this api: Stack.peek.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Stack.peek
<<<code>>>: import java.util.Stack;Stack<String> stack = new Stack<String>();String last = stack.peek();
<<<explanation>>>: The last element of a Stack is at the top of the stack.
Question: How to get the first element of a PriorityQueue in Java: I have a PriorityQueue<String> and I want to get the first element. How can I do this?
Please using this api: PriorityQueue.peek.
Answer:<<<api>>>: PriorityQueue.peek
<<<code>>>: import java.util.PriorityQueue;PriorityQueue<String> queue = new PriorityQueue<String>();String first = queue.peek();
<<<explanation>>>: The first element of a PriorityQueue is at the front of the queue.
